title: LC circuit - changes caused by increased charge

content.question:
A circuit consists of only a charged capacitor and an inductor. The charge stored on the capacitor oscillates with angular frequency <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> and the maximum current in the circuit is <math alttext="I sub maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>. How will the values of <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> and <math alttext="I sub maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math> change if the maximum charge on the capacitor is increased?
<math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math><math alttext="I sub maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>AincreasesincreasesBremains the sameincreasesCincreasesremains the sameDremains the sameremains the same

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
